file_content.text: Please... just go. I need to be alone with my thoughts.
Reports of the raid on Lord Grathan's estate are pouring in. I trust you were successful in your endeavor? My daughter Vereta is....
Vereta's not dead. I brought her back to you.
She's still alive.
I made her into a fancy paperweight.
A lovely sculpture.
If you wish you could've changed my orders, you're in luck.
You having second thoughts?
You--you froze her? Why? I was so specific in my directions.
Why in the galaxy would you do this? Why would you refuse a specific order and not... eliminate the target?
Figured you should look her in the face when she dies.
So you could do it.
When she dies? My sweet Vereta? No....
I figured it was a family affair.
This is between you and her.
You're incredibly insightful for a bounty hunter.
I get some terrible mood swings sometimes, you know?
I'm a slave to my passions.
You try to play the low-class thug, but I see right through you.
As soon as you left the premises, I realized my mistake--a mistake that would haunt me the rest of my days.
We weren't about to let that happen. Uh, sir.
You've done me a great service, hunter. She's all I have of her mother....
Great services deserve great rewards.
I'll take my credits now.
What? Oh, of course they do. Of course.
You're not going to kill her?
She lives, then?
No, of course not. Contain her, maybe. Until she can be made to see reason.
Don't get all sappy on me, all right?
Enough, already.
I apologize. My Imperial demeanor has quite fallen to pieces, hmm?
Here is your writ and your fee. Now please, I need some time with my... with my daughter.
She's as dead as it gets.
Finished.
I'm sorry. This can't be easy for you.
My condolences.
Er, thank you. Empathy from one of your species is... unexpected.
Thank you, hunter. Empathy from one of your class level is surprising.
One chunk of Sith meat, as ordered.
Carved up good.
Yes... just as you say....
Here, take your credits and go. You'll understand if I say I never want to see the face of my daughter's murderer again.
Good doing business with you.
Of course.
You may not want to go looking in any mirrors for a while.
Stay away from reflections.
Some people just don't appreciate my handiwork.
How rude.
Just go!
Come on. He needs to be alone with what he's done.
You have your assignment. My daughter is inside Grathan's compound.
Come in, mercenary. I apologize if my secretary caused you grief. He is of low birth, and his intelligence reflects it.
I'm afraid many of our Imperial soldiers are hopeless with delicate tasks. This, of course, is why I asked for a professional.
Bad soldiers are the result of bad leadership.
Imperials are poorly trained.
Often true--unfortunately, I haven't the luxury of training my assistants personally. I must take what central command sends me.
That, of course, is neither here nor there. You've come to perform a service.
Smart move.
Uh, yes. Just so.
If it's delicate you want, it's delicate you'll get.
And you got one.
I have every faith in the Mandalorian enclave's ability to get things done discreetly.
My daughter has become something of a liability to me. I want you to kill her.
Dead daughter, check. Details?
No problem.
That's something you don't hear everyday.
Your own daughter?
Then I'll assume you're newly arrived to Dromund Kaas. Things work a bit differently here.
I'm a hunter. I don't kill people unless I have to.
I'm not an assassin.
You are more than welcome to try taking her alive--but she will not allow it.
My daughter was born Force sensitive and trained to be Sith. A great honor for our family.
Unfortunately, my daughter's master is one Lord Grathan, a madman who is now disgraced in the eyes of the Dark Council.
This is some political move for you?
Not sure I follow.
Less a move than a response, but yes.
Why not just get her a new master?
Killing her is your solution?
It's outside of my control. The Sith manage their own affairs. The rest of us merely suffer the consequences.
All I need to know is where she is.
Your reasons don't matter.
I applaud your discretion, but I need you to understand the gravity of the situation.
If Lord Grathan's compound is raided and my daughter captured or killed, every member of her family will suffer. This is Sith politics.
In the best-case scenario, I lose my rank and position. In the worst....
You've got a lot to protect, Admiral.
I understand the situation.
Precisely. There is no room for failure here.
You get squashed like a bug?
Let me guess.
An inelegant way to phrase it, but yes.
This is one messed-up way to run a planet.
You Imperials are nuts.
You deal with the Empire you have, not the one you might wish you had.
Lord Grathan is a paranoid madman. His compound is built to withstand a siege, but a lone infiltrator will take them by surprise.
My daughter is somewhere inside Lord Grathan's compound. Her name is Vereta. You will know her, as she resembles me closely.
I'll handle this quiet and quick.
All right, I'm gone.
Is there going to be fallout for taking down a Sith?
You're asking a lot.
Not as long as nobody knows what happened.
One redheaded Sith child, coming up.
That makes things easier.
Yes, redheaded. Like myself. And her mother....
Hang on, I've been running some data... turns out, renegade Sith Lord followers rack up death marks like crazy.
Lord Grathan's top people all have prices on their heads.
It'd be a shame to let those bounties go to waste.
Let's collect them all.
And we might need those extra credits to gear you up for the big melee.
Lord Grathan's flunkies might be other hunters' targets.
There may be competition.
If that's true, we'll look extra impressive if we get those bounties first.
We can't afford to waste time on side jobs.
We're on a schedule.
If we see any extra bounties, there's no harm in collecting them.
Remember, discretion is essential. Do not let yourself be captured. Good luck.
I can't help you, and you can't help me.
Lovely day for planning a battle, isn't it?
